Don't worry, its steam's random updates for security, just ignore it.

If a gmae updates it will show on the client itself "Downloading ##.##(?)b [Time:time]).
God I HATE that thingie! It pops up every time I turn on my computer.
Well, it is Steam updating its security, then I can't say it's bad at all.
but either way, that thing means its set to auto-update right?

but either way, that thing means its set to auto-update right?

No but...

If you haven't turned off auto-update then it's set to auto update.

That update dialog is for updating the steam client itself. It's a program too... that gets updates. Updates for your games happen within the client and don't pop up like that. Updating your games doesn't require steam to restart or for your computer to restart.
okay, so, where on steam do I check this, because now I do not know for certain how its set on my machine :S
In Steam, right click on KSP in your library and go to properties. The Updates tab has what you need.
Go to libary, right click KSP, hit properties, click updates tab, it will see the settings.
